supportDesc.foliation: There is foliation provided in the upper right corner of each folio.

collation.note: The quire structure with this manuscript is not discernible due to the tightness of the binding and the quality of the images.

layout.ab: Primary pricks are visible, horizontal pricks are visible.
The upper line is written above the ruling, the lower line is written above the ruling.

decoDesc.summary: The manuscript is richly decorated with multiple miniatures mainly belong to the so called First Gondarine style of decoration. Paintins in the manuscript apear after thier corresponding narrations as means of illustration for the texts. Another artist with different style of decoration ( second Gondarine style of decoration) added fifteen full page images illustrating scenes from the New Testament as well as illustrations portraying saints.

decoNote.desc: A miniature of the art theme with two episodes, showing: first who is sitting on a throne and giving the book of the to who is sitting near to him on a throne, and second, receiving a gift of vestment and throne from .

A miniature of the art theme with two episodes, showing: first, 's successor who is sitting on a throne reads the and second, the successor bishop falling and being smitten by for having touched gifts to without permission.
A miniature of the art theme with two episodes, showing: first, the poor monk praying to ; second, giving the poor monk garment and food.
A miniature of the art theme with two episodes, showing: first, the peasant standing and praying near to the icon and second, who is carrying her Child, in the same depiction blessing the peasant.

A miniature illustrating with four episodes, showing: first, the Jewish priest with crossed hands praying in front of who is sitting on a throne with the two deacons in the background; second, the Jewish priest lying on the ground after his fall from excess bowing and third, raising the Jewish priest by her hand.

A miniature of the art theme with of two episodes, showing: first, Dǝmyānos writing the name of in a manuscript and second, Dǝmyānos lying down before the icon of Mary, performing a gesture of blessing (in the background, the pillar of gold, on which inscribed Dǝmyānos' name is depicted).

A miniature of the art theme with three episodes, showing: first, the bishop ʾAbbās standing and distributing holy communion surrounded by the faithful, among whom is the woman who kisses his hand; second, the bishop sitting and cutting off his hand, and third, the bishop and the faithful standing in front of the icon of the , which has healed his hand.
A miniature of the art theme with two episodes showing: first, the monk Yǝsḥaq falling on the ground during the apparition of Mary, and second, the icon of taking Yǝsḥaq by the hand and raising him.
A miniature of the art theme with one episode, showing: standing next to Māryām of Dafrā where the house represented with Jerusalem is depicted near to her.

A miniature of the art theme with three episodes, showing: first, the painter sitting on a scaffold and drawing a scene; second, the painter falling down from the scaffold and third, the icon of extending her hand to save the painter.

A miniature of the art theme with four episodes, showing, first, the sick pilgrim lying in bed; second the sick pilgrim standing before the places to which carries him; third, Golgotha, Jerusalem, the mount of Olives, Bethlehem and the Jordan are depicted; and fourth, is standing in the middle of the places depicted with a house scene background.

A miniature of the art theme with five episodes, showing from the bottom left to the right: first, Zakārǝyās praying the greeting of the angel before the icon of ; second, Zakārǝyās nailing down infront of the icon of ; third, Zakārǝyās decorating Saint Mary's crown in the icon of with roses; fourth, who is sitting on a throne surrounded by angels and the five virgins (carrying roses) and collects roses out of his mouth and fifth, the thieves being consecrated as monks.

A miniature of the art theme with two episodes, showing: first, the two thieves attempting to eat the bread they stole from Yolyānā and Barbārā and second, depicts the two thieves standing before an icon of and are being consecrated as monks.

A miniature of the art theme with six episodes, showing: first, the three Arabs swimming in the water; second, one man being eaten by a crocodile and fish surrounding the river; third, the two others standing on a rock above the water; fourth, one man riding a camel to the monastery, which is depicted in the background; fifth, the other man bringing his sheep's wool and sixth, the camel brought by the Arab eating from a tree.

A miniature of the art theme with three episodes, showing: first, surrounded by the sleeping monks of the monastery, which is depicted in the background; second, the monastery with its monks that has been moved to the shore of the see and third, a group of people marvelling at the miracle.

A miniature of the art theme with two episodes, showing: first, the priest Yoḥannǝs is depicted standing and praying before the icon of the Virgin and Childand second, taking out her breast and dropping her milk into the eyes of Yoḥannǝs.

A miniature of the art theme with four episodes, showing: first, the rich man from Qʷalāsis travelling with his companions on a ship; second, four individuals from Qʷǝz piercing the eye of the noble man; third, the rich man fallen after his eye has been pierced by arrows from the enemies and fourth, the rich man standing next to a small statue of himself in front of the icon of the .

A miniature of the art theme with four episodes, showing: first, the woman and her blind daughter standing and praying before the icon of the ; second, both lying asleep before the icon of ; third waking up the girl, and fourth, giving sight to the blind girl by dropping her breast's milk.

A miniature of the art theme with three episodes, showing: first, the poor widow praying before the the icon of the where her three daughters are sitting below her; second, the funeral of the eldest daughter, who is wrapped in a shroud and surrounded by persons, and third, the two other daughters standing next to the arborist man called Tewos.

A miniature of the art theme with four episodes, showing: first, the two brothers sitting and writing next to each other; second, the demons hanging the soul of one of the scribes; third, pulling down the scribe's soul from the demons; fourth, the scribe sitting again and resuming his writing with his brother.
A miniature of the art theme with two episodes, showing: first, lying in prison bound at his hands and feet, with a dove appearing to him; second, standing healed from his wounds.

A miniature of the art theme with three episodes, showing: first, the custodian of the church standing in front of the sitting Kaṭir ordering him to leave the church; second, sitting on a throne surrounded by two with the custodian of the church sitting before her; third, the healed Kaṭir standing before , who is sitting on throne.

A miniature of the art theme with seven episodes, showing: first, the two brothers and the Muslim customer gathered around a piece of cloth; second, the Muslim holding the cloth of Nazib with an interest to kiss him for preparing him cloths; third, the Muslim denouncing Nazib to the judge; fourth, Nazib lying in prison bound at his hands and feet; fifth, riding on a horse, brandishing a weapon, and appearing to the judge; sixth, the judge handing to Nazib his paper of release; and seventh, Nazib entering the church, in which the people are gathered, and handing his paper of release to the priest.

A miniature of the art theme with three episodes/events, showing: first, the bishop sitting on a throne before the people, who are gathered in a church, and amongst whom is the man with the petrified foot; second, the man with the petrified foot standing and praying before an icon of the while his foot is healed; third, the man showing his healed foot to the bishop with the people standing in the background.

A miniature of the art theme with seven episodes, showing: first, the leprous bishop Marqorewos standing before Patriarch Zakārǝyās and showing him his leprosy; second, the patriarch warning Merqorewos not to deliver liturgical service; third, Marqorewos praying before the icon of the ; fourth, healing the leprous bishop and performing gesture of blessing; fifth, the bishop showing himself healed to patriarch Zakārǝyās; sixth, the bishop showing himself healed to his student ; and seventh, the healed bishop distributing the Eucharist.

A miniature of the art theme with four episodes, showing: first, two men carrying the woman with a broken foot on a stretcher; second, the woman lying below the icon of the ; third, the broken foot woman again layed below the icon of on another episode; fourth, the custodian looking the broken woman who is standing near to him with the icon of depicted from the other side.

A miniature of the art theme with seven episodes, showing: first, Sofǝyā lying on top of a building before the icon of the and ordering an to take the child from Sofǝyā's womb ; second, an carries away the child from Sofǝyā's womb; third, the giving the child to Finkǝs to adopt him; fourth, the bishop sitting on a throne in front of a group of women accusing Sofǝyā; fifth, the bishop and Sofǝyā sitting next to each other discussing about the manner of the pregnancy; sixth, the bishop receiving the child from the hands of Finkǝs, sitting near to the bishop; and seventh, Sofǝyā's Child, who later become sucessessor of the former bishop (died some time before), surrounded by three persons.

A miniature of the art theme with seven episodes, showing: first, Bārok giving a wine in a vessel to his servant to distribute it to the guests; second, his guests sitting and drinking wine; third, the gusts eating food in Bārok's house; fourth; Bārok's enemies attacking him holding several weapons; fifth, a depiction of the icon of the ; sixth, Bārok being consecrated as a monk; seventh, the funeral of Bārok.

A miniature of the art theme with two episodes, showing: first, ʾAnǝsṭāsyos standing and praying in a church where the icon of the depicted in front of him; second,ʾAnǝsṭāsyos lying before the icon of , who is extending her hand towards him and announcing him good news concerning his illness.

A miniature of the art theme with four episodes, showing: first, the monk Sālusi surrounded by other monks, who are attacking him; second, the monks preventing him to eat; third, the monk Sālusi standing and praying in a church before the icon of the and fourth, the monk Sālusi stood up near to the Church after penetrating the wall of the Church with his skull-cap fallen to the ground.

A miniature of the art theme with eight episodes, showing: first, the cannibal surrounded by the bodies of those he killed; second the cannibal asking the peasant to sell his ox; third, the peasant and other inhabitants fleeing from the cannibal, with several houses depicted in the background; fourth, the cannibal offering water to a beggar covered by sores of leprosy; fifth, , sitting on a throne ordering the demons to add the soul of the cannibal to the hell and the demons holding the soul of the cannibal; sixth; two weighing the cannibal's good and bad deeds in a scale; seventh, requesting her beloved Son to give mercy for the soul of the cannibal, and eighth, holding the soul of the cannibal.

A miniature of the art theme with four episodes, showing: first, the widow's son stealing cloth from a church; second, members of the Church arresting and starting to punish the thief; third, ordering the punishers to let him free, and fourth, the thief standing in front of the icon of the who is depicted on a throne.

A miniature of the art theme with three episodes, showing: first, the woman holding her new-born child protected by from the wave; second a church amongst the waves from which the people are fleeing, and third, the woman with her child surrounded by the marvelling people.

A miniature of the art theme with three episodes, showing: first, the thirsty dog searching for water and being kicked by one of the two women sitting near to the well surrounded by plants; second, giving the dog water to drink from her shoe and, third, the group of virgins who chase out the dog gathered around the well.

These decorations are stylistically different from the illustrative miniatures and probaly could be additions by another atrist at some time after the completion of the first hand textual and decorative compostion of the mansucript. They contain images of several saints, martyrs and other divine scenes.

history.provenance: This manuscript is a part of the collection gathered by during his stay in Ethiopia and neigbouring regions in 1837-48.

bibl.citedRange: Pars posterior, quae continet apparatum criticum.

projectDesc.p: Encoded according to TEI P5 Guidelines.

revisionDesc.change: Added elements on the first miracle
Added elements on the second miracle
Added elements on the third miracle
Added elements on the three miracles
Edited folio numbers and typo errors
Added elements on a hymn and images
updated IDs on the narration abou the poor monk
